sentences.english: Because of the scandal the school has fallen into disrepute.
sentences.chinese: 醜聞使這所學校名譽掃地。

sentences.english: Today’s scandal-a-month journalism has clearly gotten out of control.
sentences.chinese: 今天，“醜聞月月有”的新聞工作顯然已經失控。

sentences.english: Mr. A has righted the scandals in his office.
sentences.chinese: 先生的辦公室醜聞，已經改正過來。
把所有的醜聞都說給我聽。

sentences.english: The public have an insatiable appetite for scandal.
sentences.chinese: 公衆對醜聞總是喜聞樂道。

sentences.english: The scandal about the President is quickly being noised abroad.
sentences.chinese: 有關總統的醜聞正迅速傳播開來。

sentences.english: In the wake of the scandal, the senator's one-time adherents quietly deserted him.
sentences.chinese: 因爲醜聞，該參議院昔日的追隨者悄然棄他而去。

sentences.english: Indeed, many were unaware of the scandal at the French bank.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，很多人都不知道法國興業銀行的這個醜聞。

sentences.english: But in the wake of the Fannie Mae scandal, Raines still had legions of supporters.
sentences.chinese: 但在房利美醜聞後，雷恩斯仍有一大批支持者。

sentences.english: The scandal will not detract from her fame.
sentences.chinese: 這件醜聞將無損於她的名聲。

sentences.english: In the former Soviet Union, corruption scandals can spark usurpation.
sentences.chinese: 在前蘇聯，腐敗醜聞可引發篡權。

sentences.english: Critics say he mishandled the sex-abuse scandal that has rocked the Roman Catholic Church.
sentences.chinese: 也有人認爲他對震撼羅馬天主教會的性醜聞處理不當。

sentences.english: Was he thinking of the scandals generated by the Profumo Affair?
sentences.chinese: 他有沒有想到普羅富莫情事引來的醜聞呢？

sentences.english: The report on this scandal appeared on the front-page of the Washington Post.
sentences.chinese: 這樁醜聞的報道出現在了《華盛頓郵報》的頭版。

sentences.english: You may recall Strauss-Kahn's caught up in a sex scandal.
sentences.chinese: 你可以回憶一下，卡恩現在深陷性侵犯醜聞。

sentences.english: He could not but cough up his political scandal.
sentences.chinese: 他迫不得已只好吐露出他的政治醜聞。

definition: to expose/to bring to light/to disclose/revelation
to make use of one's position to gain profit for oneself or one's associates
to be related/to entail/to involve/joint (liability etc)
more and more emerge/innumerable succession/breeding like flies (idiom)
